data.enText: to get a free ride in a person's car; to travel around in this way, by standing at the side of the road and trying to get passing cars to stop

data.chText: 他们搭乘了一辆路过的货车。
data.enText: They hitched a ride in a truck.
They hitched a lift .

data.chText: 我们借搭便车在欧洲各地旅行了一个夏天。
data.enText: We spent the summer hitching around Europe.
to pull up a piece of your clothing
She hitched up her skirt and waded into the river.
to lift yourself into a higher position, or the position mentioned
She hitched herself up.

data.chText: 他一跃坐到了酒吧间的高凳上。
data.enText: He hitched himself onto the bar stool.
to fix sth to sth else with a rope, a hook, etc.
She hitched the pony to the gate.
get hitched
to get married

data.chText: 暂时的困难（或问题）；故障；障碍
data.enText: a problem or difficulty that causes a short delay
The ceremony went off without a hitch .
a technical hitch
a type of knot
a clove hitch
get hitched
to get married

tr: the uneven manner of walking that results from an injured leg
any obstruction that impedes or is burdensome
a knot that can be undone by pulling against the strain that holds it
a connection between a vehicle and the load that it pulls
the state of inactivity following an interruption
example: during the halt he got some lunch
the momentary stay enabled him to escape the blow
he spent the entire stop in his seat

tr: a period of time spent in military service

example: One foot caught in the stirrup

tr: connect to a vehicle: "hitch the trailer to the car"
jump vertically, with legs stiff and back arched
walk impeded by some physical limitation or injury
example: The old woman hobbles down to the store every day

tr: travel by getting free rides from motorists

value.def: A hitch is a slight problem or difficulty which causes a short delay.

example.ex: After some technical hitches the show finally got under way...
example.tran: 一些小技术故障解决后，演出终于开始了。

example.ex: The five-hour operation went without a hitch.
example.tran: 5小时的手术进行得非常顺利。

value.def: If you hitch ,hitch a lift, or hitch a ride, you hitchhike.

example.ex: There was no garage in sight, so I hitched a lift into town...
example.tran: 放眼望去看不到修车厂，所以我就搭顺风车进了城。

example.ex: Jean-Phillippe had hitched all over Europe in the 1960s.
example.tran: 让－菲利普在20世纪60年代曾搭便车游遍欧洲。

value.def: If you hitch something to something else, you hook it or fasten it there.

example.ex: Last night we hitched the horse to the cart and moved here.
example.tran: 昨晚我们套上马车，拉着东西搬到了这里。

value.def: If you get hitched, you get married.

example.ex: The report shows that fewer couples are getting hitched.
example.tran: 报告显示，结婚的人数呈下降趋势。

trans: 半结(常用以将某物拴在柱子上)
